column4: I still cannot mount a drive. I cannot look at what is on a DVD and it sucks
Unable to mount location.  No media in the drive.  There is too something in it lol
How do I fix this?
I click on Computer under placed and dbl-click on CD-RW/DVD+-RW Drive
All I want to do is browse the files on my DVD and it will not let me lol
I click on Computer under placed and dbl-click on CD-RW/DVD+-RW Drive
Aye
Ubuntu is not letting me watch Transformers and drool over Megan Fox and that is just not cool. I need to fix this
I also want to be able to browse my DVD like I would a folder and it is not letting me. I keep getting this no mounted and no media in drive crap
No
what happens when you try to mount it from the command line?
click Applications -> Accessories -> Terminal
from there, 'sudo mount /dev/cdrom /mnt/'
ubuntu will usually unmount the CD behind the scenes when you press eject
wait ...
have you installed libdvdcss?
dpkg --get-selections | grep libdvdcss
are you trying to play an actual legit DVD?
you might have a region mismatch
check out the 'regionset' package
perhaps.  have you ever been able to play this specific DVD on that specific drive before?
try installing the gstreamer-plugins-{good,bad,ugly} packages
without the output from dmesg | tail i can't diagnose further
